memoryVerse: "Exalted to the right hand of God, he has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit and has poured out what you now see and hear." â€“ Acts 2:33

one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read Acts 3:1-10.
Peter healed the beggar who was lame.

questions.questionText: 3. Describe what happened to the beggar. What was the response of others?
4. Read John 10:10; Romans 10:17; Ephesians 2:1, 5, 8. In what ways does the healing of the man point to Jesus Christ's spiritual healing of a person?
5. What work of God in your life could you praise Him for?
6. Which marginalized person or people in your community need the same help and hope Peter gave the beggar?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read Acts 3:11-26.
Peter challenged the onlookers to repent and be saved.

questions.questionText: 7. What part did the people have in the death of Jesus? What part did God have in His Son's death and resurrection?
8. What hope did Peter offer the people? How does the conviction and mercy of this passage apply to people today?
9. How does the fulfillment of prophecy impact your trust in God's promises today? Where are you challenged to trust God and His promises?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read Acts 4:1-22.
Peter and John were arrested and testified.

questions.questionText: 10. What is the central message Peter proclaimed? What difference does it make?
11. a. What were the results of John and Peter's actions and testimony?
11. b. What lessons can you apply to your life today?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read Acts 4:23-37.
The believers came together to share praise, prayer and possessions.

questions.questionText: 12. What was included in the prayer in verses 24-30? How could you apply this to your prayers?
13. a. What are some personal changes that took place when people were filled with the Holy Spirit?
13. b. What changes has the Holy Spirit made in you?
14. What would you like to see God do in your life this week?
